main event: An object with 14 satellite bodies was observed moving from north to south and then west, disappearing beyond a mountain range. The object was luminous and had a constant shining appearance.
interesting points: The object was observed on several occasions over the course of the sighting.
The object displayed characteristics of a satellite observation.
There were radar and visual observations of unidentified objects reported by the control tower at Calama, Argentina on December 6 and 13, 1957.
The sighting lasted for approximately 3 minutes.
The document mentions communications from the Argentine Army and Air Force regarding sightings of unidentified flying objects.
photographs: No photographs included in the report
